definitions.text: a mechanical device for gripping an object
the act of catching an object with the hands
examples: Mays made the catch with his back to the plate
he made a grab for the ball before it landed
Martin's snatch at the bridle failed and the horse raced away
the infielder's snap and throw was a single motion

definitions.text: take hold of so as to seize or restrain or stop the motion of
get hold of or seize quickly and easily
examples: I snapped up all the good buys during the garage sale

definitions.text: make a grasping or snatching motion with the hand
examples: The passenger grabbed for the oxygen mask
She grabbed the child's hand and ran out of the room
